snippet: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, Columbus Day was a great day for a parade, but not for answering questions about an embattled City Hall aide.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes New York Mayor Bill de Blasio was keen to avoid questions about Rachel Noerdlinger, chief of staff to his wife Chirlane McCray, at Columbus Day parade; points out Noerdlinger has a boyfriend with criminal record, which she did not disclose in city forms, is working off a tax lien and has unpaid parking tickets; says de Blasio has been reticent in explaining where Noerdlinger fell short in vetting process but he has been effusive with praise.
lead_paragraph: For Mayor Bill de Blasio, Columbus Day was a great day for a parade, but not for answering questions about an embattled City Hall aide.
